SMW Subobject for NormalExamine: A defensive weapon.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Rune defenderUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Rune defender.pngWeight: 0.453Value: 65004Version anchor: NormalRelease date: 13 June 2006Item ID: 8850

The rune defender is the 3rd strongest defender. It is used for its attack bonus and is held in the off-hand in place of a shield. It requires 40 Attack and 40 Defence to wield. The rune defender is dropped by cyclopes on the top floor of the Warriors' Guild after showing an adamant defender or better as the player enters the room.

The rune defender's slash and crush defensive bonuses are the same as a black kiteshield, but its stab defence bonus is slightly less than an adamant square shield. However, it is much more commonly used for its melee bonuses, as it gives the same bonus to strength as the toktz-ket-xil (obsidian shield) and has melee attack bonuses. A rune defender is commonly combined with weapons such as a dragon scimitar or an abyssal whip as a result.

The defender is popular among players of higher combat levels due to its offensive stats. It can be considered to be the third best off-hand item for melee training, only beaten by the dragon defender and Avernic defender, and is commonly used in PvP situations as re-obtaining a rune defender is easier than re-obtaining a dragon or Avernic one.

If the player dies below level 20 Wilderness, it will remain in the player's inventory. However, the item will be unusable and must be repaired with 35,000 coins by using the item on Perdu. If the player dies above level 20 Wilderness they will drop 7,800 coins.

Players can attach a Rune defender ornament kit, obtained from hard Treasure Trails, to create a Rune defender (t). This is only cosmetic, and does not affect the defender's stat bonuses. It can be dismantled, returning the defender and ornament kit.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
7 July 2021
(update)

The defender's position on female players has been adjusted so that they appear to be equipped properly.

8 August 2013
(update)

Some feedback changes have been made to the config costs of the fire cape, rune defender and penance items, including the penance skirt.

2 August 2013
(update | poll)

The item's value was increased from 1 to 65,004 so it is protected over rune armour on death.

The '''rune defender''' is the 3rd strongest [[defender]]. It is used for its attack bonus and is held in the off-hand in place of a [[shield]]. It requires 40 [[Attack]] and 40 [[Defence]] to wield. The rune defender is dropped by [[Cyclops|cyclopes]] on the top floor of the [[Warriors' Guild]] after showing an [[adamant defender]] or better as the player enters the room.

The rune defender's slash and crush defensive bonuses are the same as a [[black kiteshield]], but its stab defence bonus is slightly less than an [[adamant square shield]]. However, it is much more commonly used for its melee bonuses, as it gives the same bonus to strength as the [[toktz-ket-xil]] (obsidian shield) and has melee attack bonuses. A rune defender is commonly combined with weapons such as a [[dragon scimitar]] or an [[abyssal whip]] as a result.

The defender is popular among players of higher [[combat level]]s due to its offensive stats. It can be considered to be the third best off-hand item for melee training, only beaten by the [[dragon defender]] and [[Avernic defender]], and is commonly used in [[PvP]] situations as re-obtaining a rune defender is easier than re-obtaining a dragon or Avernic one.

If the player dies below level 20 [[Wilderness]], it will remain in the player's inventory. However, the item will be unusable and must be repaired with 35,000 coins by using the item on [[Perdu]]. If the player dies above level 20 Wilderness they will drop 7,800 coins.

Players can attach a [[Rune defender ornament kit]], obtained from [[Clue scroll (hard)|hard]] [[Treasure Trails]], to create a [[Rune defender (t)]]. This is only cosmetic, and does not affect the defender's stat bonuses. It can be dismantled, returning the defender and ornament kit.
